message.content:
cs.CR, cs.NI, cs.DC, cs.DS, cs.SE 

This paper discusses privacy issues in the Domain Name System (DNS) and proposes a Privacy-Preserving Domain Name System (PPDNS) as a solution. The paper focuses on security and privacy concerns in computer networks, which falls under the category of "Cryptography and Security" (cs.CR). Additionally, the proposed solution involves distributed hash tables (DHTs) and computational private information retrieval (cPIR), which are relevant to the sub-categories of "Networking and Internet Architecture" (cs.NI), "Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing" (cs.DC), and "Data Structures and Algorithms" (cs.DS). Finally, the paper also discusses the implementation and analysis of the proposed solution, which falls under the sub-category of "Software Engineering" (cs.SE).
